definition:
The *Stone-functor* $S: Top^{op} \rightarrow Boo$ (where $Boo$ is the
construct of boolean algebras and boolean homomorphisms) assigns to each
topological space the boolean algebra of its clopen subsets, and for any
continuous map $f: X \rightarrow Y$; i.e. for any morphism
$f: Y \rightarrow X$ in $Top^{op}$, $Sf: S(Y) \rightarrow S(X)$ is given
by $Sf(Z) = f^{-1}[Z]$.
